Hey.

I'm back from Colorado. The vacation was, honestly, quite awkward. Not only because I was an idiot and packed the wrong clothes (WHY did I think skirts and heels would work in the mountains?!?)but more because I have recently found it difficult to function as a part of my family. I'm kinda in a stage in my life where I am really enjoying my independence and freedom, and it is becoming more and more difficult for me to give that up and become part of the Wilson clan again. Plus, I'm at an awkward age: too old (and not patient enough) to hang with the little kids, but "too young" to be considered an adult. So I get to hang with...myself. Remind me to never go on another family vacation again.

You guys, when we get back to school, I have a ton of stories to tell you all. Be prepared.

Getting emails and random messages from my Cornell friends has only made me even more excited to get back up to Iowa. I have a REALLY good feeling about this year (actually, that's a bad sign, but I'm ignoring that fact). Last year, I was still a little sad to leave home, but this year, well...I'm ready to get out of here. Honestly, the only things I think I'll miss will be my car and my dog. And living in a city. Thats about it.

I have become such a loser this summer. Honestly, my life mostly consists of me working, reading, and sleeping. And sometimes going out, but thats becoming more and more rare as the summer comes to a close. A lot of times, my friends and I will get together to, like, watch a movie. Or go out to eat. How boring. What has happened to my life?!? I remember it being much more exciting than this. What happened to all the drinking and club-hopping and partying and, well...other things? You know your life is sad when you can't wait to get to Mt. Vernon to have some fun :(

I miss you all and hope everyone is doing super good. If you love me, you should definitely pray for rain in KC this weekend...I'm getting sick of driving around on that beer cart:)

I know, I know. Its been awhile since you all've heard from me. I'm sorry for being so anti-social, but honestly, I was in desperate need of a break. I needed a good, long month away from everything that is Cornell College. I needed some time to myself. However, I realized yesterday that my break was over; that I as much as I try to deny it, I need some Cornell in my life every once in awhile.(How did I realize this? My dad and I were trying to come up with unique and different names for my future sons, and my dad suggested I name one of them Bartholomew...and suddenly, I missed Cornell with all my heart.)
So how have I been spending the last month of my life? Um...work is going well, except for the fact that they've decided to limit the beer cart hours to weekends only. This means that I have a choice to make: work fewer hours or switch to working banquets during the weekdays. This has caused some un-neccessary stress in my life and has given me deeper sympathy for people who've been laid off due to job cuts. I've fallen in love with a lot of new things since I've left Cornell: coffee shops, reading, country music, diet cherry limeades, Gavin DeGraw, old reruns of Dawson's Creek, Before Sunrise, and playing the piano. So...this is what my life has mostly consisted of so far this summer. Its been...inspiring. I love it.
Hope everyone else is doing well.Honestly, there not much else for me to write about...I've been enjoying this calm that has taken over my life. Its given me time to, well, be happy for a little while.

I am soooo happy that I have surrounded myself with good people. If I honestly look at the people that I have relationships with (serious, close relationships that is) I have some of the greatest friends in the world. I don't know if I am good at judging people's character or just really lucky, but most, if not all, of my friends are good, decent people. I watch people around me and look at their friendships, and I think, wow. If my friendships were like that I'd shoot myself. Its so unbelievably fake. I love that with all of my friends, I can be as stupid as I want and (hopefully) no one ever thinks any less of me. I love that even though I can be such a loser, I have people around me that don't care. Some people define their friends as people that they enjoy hanging out with. I define my friends as people that I have a connection with. I don't just "go out" with my friends and see movies or go shopping and talk about boys and "the kids" and our lives. I have some really unbelievable conversations about life and people and, well, "real" things. I have friends that challenge me. Thats nice. It is so comforting to know that if I ever mess up (which I do A LOT), there are people in this world that have my back. People that, for the rest of my life, will always be there for me. And I will always be there for them. Its the difference between just having friends you hang out with, and friends that you will have for life. And while I have both kinds of friendships, I really heart (sorry Gabby) my real ones.

I've decided that Thanksgiving is my favorite holiday. Why? Well, first off, Thanksgiving is basically a excuse to stuff yourself full of good food, and as we all know, I am always up for that. Second, Thanksgiving break seems to be just long enough. Not too long, cause I'd start getting bored or used to being back home and not want to come back to Cornell. And, when its over, you don't have to be sad, cause hey, Christmas is less than 3 weeks away. Yes, Thanksgiving is a wonderful holiday...
Wish something incredably exciting happened over my break, cause then I'd have something fun to write about in here. Don't get me wrong, it was a lot of fun...but pretty damn typical. Here's an overview, more for my sake than yours. If I don't write it down, I'll forget.
Wednesday: Class. Sat on my ass for, oh, 5 hours waiting to leave Cornell. That was just as horrible as I predicted. Then drove to KC. Surprisingly, seemed like a really quick trip. Drove with Glynnis and Stephanie(?) from 2nd floor. They talked about pot a lot. I slept. Got back home. Saw my "challenged" dog who now has no recollection of me whatsoever. My friends came over. Got to meet Taylor, the dreaded boyfriend. Nice guy, but its hard for me to see my friends with their new boyfriends. It only brings on the inevitable feeling of loneliness and being left behind. Drank. A lot. Of my parents alcohol. Good times. 
Thursday: Woke up. Helped my mom with the Thanksgiving dinner. My aunt and her family came. Good to see them. Tried to play with the new baby. Decided that I am going to be the worst mother in the whole wide world. Ate. A LOT. Hung out, watched TV, the typical Thanksgiving stuff. Later that night, watched Love Actually with my mom and aunt. Once again, inevitable feeling of loneliness.
Friday: Shopping. Eating. Buying new clothes. Seeing people I really didn't want to see. Reminded me that I really hate being surrounded by gorgeous, rich people. Later that night, rented Cabin Fever (I'm serious, if you haven't seen this movie yet, we need to plan a night to watch it. I've never laughed so hard in my whole life. Greatest horror film ever made.) Watched that with my friends. Again, damn good times.
Saturday: Watched Disney movies. Thats right, I spent my afternoon watching Sleeping Beauty and The Lion King. Don't make fun of me, you know you wish you were there. That night, went to the Plaza. Ate at Kona Grille. Walked around the Plaza with all the Christmas lights and stuff. Went to Skies, which is always a fun time. Heard about a party at Grinham's, so we drove all the way out to the country to her house. Got there, and there was no party. Never felt more stupid in my life.
Sunday: Church at 7:30am. Never want to be up that early again. Packed up. Left. Spent the ride home listening to the Beatles and talking about pot (again). It was the perfect car ride for Gabbie.
Like I said, nothing exciting. Sorry. Some of it was fun, some not. Lots of lonely moments. Basically, I need a boyfriend. I think my parents are getting worried. Hope they don't think I'm a lesbian!
